summary:
The main challenge encountered by contemporary PUBLIC ADMINISTRATORS is effective, efficient & sustainable management of public, private, and third sector organizations amid complex internal & external environmental factors.
After graduation from undergraduate college , I learnt manual typing in English & Arabic at a private business school few months later. During the same time, I enrolled in an advanced  English course at the American Centre in Khartoum II and obtained a certificate of completion. Moreover, I held four) junior administrative positions: (three) as government employee (assistant finance officer/ assistant taxation officer) and (one) as NGO staff (relief & emergency coordinator) of PHC program. All roles from 1988 till 1991.
My other work experiences were with profit & non-profit organizations in the areas of Administration, Education, Women & Youth Empowerment /  Networking from 1991 till 2002 in Egypt and the Netherlands.

From  2003 to 2007, I was actively involved with displaced South Sudanese NGO in greater Khartoum, Sudan in setting up  micro & small businesses  (project proposals/impact assessment/monitoring, evaluation & learning), teaching English and History as a part-time teacher in a private secondary school and working as a translator in a private daily English newspaper: Khartoum Monitor.

From April 2007 to August 2016, I moved to South Sudan in pursuit of better employment prospects: Firstly, I worked as the head of the translation unit at the Secretariat General of the Upper Nile state government in Malakal town.Secondly,in about one year time, I got another job as senior diplomat and ambassador with the Government of South Sudan (GoSS) in Juba, the capital of South Sudan.

Recently, I performed some volunteer work as a hostess for Kwintes Foundation in Hilversum from January to September 2019.
Afterwards, I tried to shift my activities entirely to the private sector as sole trader/ management consultant, but due to unforeseeable circumstances was unable to pursue that goal. Thereafter, I had to instantally terminate all the planned activities.
New and bold initiatives are emerging towards the end of 2020 and the beginning of 2021 till the end of 2022.
The year 2023 will be full of surprises, challenges and new opportunities.

Essential hospitality services include accommodation, hot & cold meals and drinks, snacks; internet; & TV entertainmbyent for smokers & non-smokers; and other services in collaboration with the team of assigned social workers,  security guards and other volunteers.', 'title': 'Volunteer Hostess', 'employment_type': 'Part-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'MRC / MFA & IC ', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'South Sudan', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2008}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'MRC / MFA & IC ', 'description': 'Worked as senior Diplomat / Director for Europe department at the  Ministry of Regional Cooperation - Government of South  Sudan ( GoSS) from  March 2008 till February 2010. Afterward was deployed as deputy Principal Officer for South Sudan Liaison Office in Pretoria, South Africa responsible for Administration & Finace from March 2010 till July 2012. Within the capacity of my work, I supervised 16 national & local staff.
After the Independence, our Ministry was transformed into Ministry of Foreign Affairs & International Cooperation of the Republic of South Sudan.
In March 2012,  I was among the first group of  Ambassadors appointed by the new Republic of South Sudan.
From August 2012 till December 2013, I assumed the responsibilies of Deputy Directors of European Affairs / Capacity Building & Training Departments. Once again, reassigned the former role of deputy director of European affairs till the national disintegration in December 2013.
From January 2015 till August 2016 I was assigned  the role of Director of Crisis Management Department with a small team of Deputy Director and two junior diplomats accountable to the office of the Undersecretary - CEO. My duties include overseeing and monitoring local, national and regional (East African Region) crises.
In February 2018,  I was finally relieved from working in South Sudan public Service as Ambassador in absentia by a presidential decree with other colleagues.', 'title': 'Senior Diplomat & Ambassador', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Secretariate General of Upper Nile state government', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Upper Nile state - Malakal', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'company': 'Secretariate General of Upper Nile state government', 'description': 'The translation unit is responsible for professional  technical translation / interpretation of all government official documents during regular weekly cabinet meetings and any other extra-ordinary meetings. Furthermore, these docments are kept carefully in a secure paper and electronic files/ records.', 'title': 'Head of translation unit (Arabic - English) , (English - Arabic)', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}]
volunteer_experiences:
[{'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2003}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2007}}, 'role': 'Volunteer Consultant  - Micro Small & Medium Enterprises (MS&MEs) ', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Help Yourself Society (HYS)', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'POVERTY_ALLEVIATION', 'description': "Help Yourself Society (HYS) is a national NGO working for the interests of displaced women and youth in greater national capital Khartoum, Sudan especially those urban poor living at the peroripheries of the capital.

My master thesis focused on the management of informal micro and small enterprises that provide income and employment opportunities for a substantial portion of urban and rural poor in large number of developing countries in Africa,  Asia and Latin America. However, home-based  enterprises play also a vital role in the underground invisible economies of  the first and second world.

My role was helping the managment committe of the organization chaired in the areas of  project proposals; impact assessmen;  monitoring,  evaluation & learning processes as organisation resource person and consultant.

HYS had a shop called ' African Look ' where it displayed its handicrafts for sale to its wide range of customers mainly foreign expatriates. It also participated in annual bazaars, exhibitions and other functions including women empowerment workshops & fundraising events conducted by its  donors,  affliates and partners inside and outside Sudan.

In November 2004, Help  Yourself  Society (HYS) participated at Micro Credit Summit held in Amman, Jordan with other regional and international groups through attending  workshops sessions, seminars and panels. in addition to displaying its African handicrafts products at the exhibition stand with other participants from all parts of the world.

Furthermore, in 2005, HYS participated once again in South - South dialogue organised by South Sudanese civil society organisations in Nairobi before the signing of the comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) where  most SPLM leaders were present during  highly engaged popular cosutunsultation with South Sudanese grassroots organisations before the signing of Sudan's peace agreement in 2005 in Nairobi, Kenya that ended the longest civil strife in  modern Africa."}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2005}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2006}}, 'role': 'Part-time English and History teacher', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Al Salaam Evangelical college', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'EDUCATION', 'description': 'A Private primary & secondary school located at the centre of the capital Khartoum, owned and run by the Evangelical church of the Sudan.
English lessons were provided from primary up to secondary level.

I taught English and History to two secondary school classes, one was for students preparing to sit for the final examination.
Students and teachers came from different cultural, religious and racial backgrounds.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2004}, 'end': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2005}}, 'role': 'Translator', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Khartoum Monitor daily English Newspaper', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'POLITICS', 'description': 'My role was ranslation of daily news headlines, field reports and updates collected by journalists in Arabic to modern day English language

The newspaper was owned by a private company limited in Khartoum, Sudan till its reclocation to South Sudan after its independence. Afterwards, the newspaper was renamed " Juba Monitor ".

I worked in a team with the editor-in-chief office and a group of colleagues: translators, editors & journalists.'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1999}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2001}}, 'role': 'Administrative Assistant', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'TIYE International', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'CIVIL_RIGHTS', 'description': "TIYE International is a national NGO plateform for black, migrant and refugees womens' organisations in the Netherlands.  It is women's advocacy organisation caring for issues related to the target group at national (Netherlands), regional (EU), and international (UN) levels."}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 1995}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1995}}, 'role': 'Volunteer Programmer', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': "Sudanese Women's Voice for Peace", 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'CIVIL_RIGHTS', 'description': "Sudanese Women's Voice for Peace was established by South Sudanese Displaced women in Egypt (in Cairo, Alexandria and other cities) to voice out their concerns about ending the civil war to local NGos as well as other lobby groups at regional and international levels.
My role as programmer of the executive committee was to coordinate different activities of the group; holding regular meetings with the target group; building leadership qualities within the group through empowerment strategies; fundraising and other activities."}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}, 'end': {'month': 6, 'day': None, 'year': 1995}}, 'role': 'Volunteer English teacher', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': "St. Andrew's Church in Cairo - Egypt", 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'EDUCATION', 'description': "The aim of the Sudanese programme was provision of good quality English language courses from beginners to advaced level  to refugees and displaced  adults from the horn of Africa residing in Egypt under the umbrella of St. Andrew's church led by an American English tutor and assisted by a team of volunteers from diverse backgrounds.

The programme was managed by volunteer American English tutor, assisted by a group of volunteers including myself.
There was  a wide range of educational materials available for teaching purposes. However this programme was terminated and replaced by a new project."}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 1994}}, 'role': "Women's Activist", 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Displaced South Sudanese Women group', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'HUMAN_RIGHTS', 'description': 'Participated at  NGOs Forum 94 UN International Conference on Population and Development in Cairo  / Egypt in July 1994 and NGO Forum 94 Regional Conference on Women in Dakar / Sengegal in November the same year as South Sudanese women activists in Egypt concerned about women and children rights in war situations by emphazising on  harmful effects & consequences of the civil war on their daily normal lives.'}]
